model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: What instrument do you play? 
Speaker B: I don't know play instrument. Only  I enjoy rock music.
Speaker A: ah right, who's your favourite rock band?
Speaker B: I'm big fan of aerosmith. When do you learn music. Whom teach you?
Speaker A: aerosmith are great, have you ever seen them live? I have been playing drums since i was a kid, my father taught me when I was young and from then on I just taught myself
Speaker B: That's awesome! I have been trying to learn last one year. Still I didn't get right teacher. I'm jealous on you. I don't have like your dad.
Speaker A: what instrument have you been trying to learn?
Speaker B: Piano is my favorite instrument. When try play my mind was mesmerizing. How do you learn surfering?
Speaker A: I learnt to surf from one of my good friends, he surfed in a number of competitions and did very well. Would you like to learn to surf if you had more time?
Speaker B: Yes, I would like to learn surfing with my friends at weekend. But my friends didn't have interesting on surfing.

MEMORY:
Speaker A, who grew up in California on the beach, loves morning surfing as a way to escape from daily life. Additionally, Speaker A is preoccupied with not dying when surfing. 
Speaker B wishes they had time to go surfing and is considering getting lessons at a surf shop. Furthermore, Speaker B finds fishing easier than surfing but is interested in trying surfing, and is willing to teach Speaker A how to fish and cook. 
Speaker A was good at writing in school, while Speaker B was bad at math and preferred fishing. Speaker B is looking forward to taking a break from work and going fishing.
